title: Share of women of reproductive age who have anemia vs. GDP per capita
subtitle: The share of women of reproductive age (aged 15-49) who are defined as anemic, versus gross domestic product (GDP) per capita, measured in constant international-$. Prevalence of anemia among women of reproductive age refers to the combined prevalence of both non-pregnant with haemoglobin levels below 12 g/dL and pregnant women with haemoglobin levels below 11 g/dL.

display.name: Women of reproductive age with anemia

sourceDesc: Data compiled from multiple sources by World Bank
